DOC.brief_summary: The aim intervention study evaluate acute chronic effect different intensity ( mild , moderate high intensity ) aerobic exercise blood pressure level subject classify resistant hypertension . Resistant hypertensive subject age 40 70 , men woman body mass index lower 40 kg/m² recruit subjected acute phase three session aerobic exercise : mild , moderate , high intensity ; session control . After , subject randomly allocate four intervention group : mild intensity group , moderate intensity group , high intensity group control group . In phase , subject blood pressure data record ambulatory blood pressure monitoring , clinic ambulatory analysis . In addition , continuously register biological sign blood pressure ( finometer ) , electrocardiogram ( DII derivation ) blood flow ( venous occlusion plethysmography ) analysis cardiac autonomic modulation , vascular autonomic modulation , baroreflex sensitivity , vasodilator response peripheral vascular resistance .
